------=_NextPart_000_0020_01C2840F.1FA5CA50
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Dave,
 
The latest version of the Python interface is missing the zero-D reactor
object. It is actually working fine in the latest unreleased version,
and in fact is significantly more capable than the old version. I have
only been waiting to release it to finish some documentation. But at the
rate that is going, perhaps it is better to release it with some very
brief documentation for now. Let me see what I can do quickly. 
 
Other than that, zero-D kinetics are working in the MATLAB version,
using MATLAB's integrators.
 
Dave G.
 

-----Original Message-----
From: E David Huckaby [mailto:e.david.huckaby@...] 
Sent: Monday, November 04, 2002 2:06 PM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Python reactor object


Prof. Goodwin,
 
I seem to be having problems finding the python 0D-"Reactor" object
which was available in the previous version of the package.   The object
is still 
in the C++ library and there seems to be parts of the reactor object in
the file 
"../Cantera/python/src/canteramodule.cpp", but nothing available in
python.
 
If it is not currently implemented, what would you suggest as a work
around ?
 
thanks,
 
Dave
 

To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
cantera-unsubscribe@egroups.com



Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service
<http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/> .
